question_text: What is React Native?
option_d: React Native is an open-source framework for building native mobile apps using React and JavaScript.

question_text: Who developed React Native?
option_d: React Native was developed by Facebook and released in 2015.

question_text: Why choose React Native over other frameworks?
option_d: For cross-platform development

question_text: How is React Native different from React?
option_d: React is for web apps
correct_answer: React Native is for mobile apps using native components instead of HTML.

question_text: When should you use React Native?
option_d: When you need to build iOS and Android apps with shared codebase and faster development.

question_text: Where does React Native code run?
option_d: React Native code runs in JavaScript runtime but renders to native UI components.

question_text: What platforms does React Native support?
option_d: iOS and Android primarily

question_text: How do you install React Native?
option_d: Using React Native CLI: npx react-native init ProjectName

question_text: What are the system requirements for React Native?
option_d: Node.js

question_text: Why do you need Node.js for React Native?
option_d: Node.js provides npm/yarn for package management and JavaScript runtime environment.

question_text: How do you create a new React Native project?
option_d: npx react-native init MyProject or using Expo: npx create-expo-app MyProject

question_text: What is Expo in React Native?
option_d: A framework and platform for universal React applications

question_text: When should you use Expo vs React Native CLI?
option_d: Expo for faster setup and managed workflow
correct_answer: CLI for more control and native modules.

question_text: How do you run a React Native app on Android?
option_d: npx react-native run-android or using Android Studio emulator.

question_text: How do you run a React Native app on iOS?
option_d: npx react-native run-ios or using Xcode simulator.

question_text: What is Metro bundler?
option_d: The JavaScript bundler for React Native that transpiles and bundles code.

question_text: How do you start Metro bundler?
option_d: npx react-native start or npm start in project directory.

question_text: What is hot reloading in React Native?
option_d: Automatically reloads the app when code changes without losing app state.

question_text: How do you enable hot reloading?
option_d: Press Ctrl+M (Android) or Cmd+D (iOS) and select "Enable Hot Reloading".

question_text: What is the basic structure of a React Native component?
option_d: Similar to React: import React

question_text: How do you create a functional component in React Native?
option_d: function MyComponent() { return <View>...</View>; } export default MyComponent;

question_text: What is View component in React Native?
option_d: A container that supports layout with flexbox

question_text: What is Text component in React Native?
option_d: A component for displaying text

question_text: How do you add text in React Native?
option_d: <Text>Hello World</Text> inside a View component.

question_text: What is StyleSheet in React Native?
option_d: An API to create style objects with performance benefits and validation.

question_text: How do you apply styles in React Native?
option_d: Using style prop: <View style={styles.container}> and StyleSheet.create()

question_text: Why use StyleSheet instead of inline styles?
option_d: Better performance

question_text: What is flexbox in React Native?
option_d: A layout model that arranges items in a container

question_text: How do you center content using flexbox?
option_d: Using justifyContent: 'center' and alignItems: 'center' in container style.

question_text: What is the difference between justifyContent and alignItems?
option_d: justifyContent aligns along main axis

question_text: How do you handle touch events in React Native?
option_d: Using TouchableOpacity

question_text: What is TouchableOpacity?
option_d: A wrapper for making views respond properly to touches with opacity feedback.

question_text: How do you create a button in React Native?
option_d: Using <Button> component or TouchableOpacity with Text inside.

question_text: What is the difference between Button and TouchableOpacity?
option_d: Button has fixed styling
correct_answer: TouchableOpacity is customizable with any child component.

question_text: How do you handle user input in React Native?
option_d: Using TextInput component for text entry.

question_text: What is TextInput component?
option_d: A component for entering text via keyboard with various configuration options.

question_text: How do you create a text input field?
option_d: <TextInput style={styles.input} placeholder="Enter text" onChangeText={handleChange} />

question_text: What is state management in React Native?
option_d: Managing and updating component data that can change over time.

question_text: How do you use useState hook in React Native?
option_d: Same as React: const [state

question_text: What is useEffect hook in React Native?
option_d: Handles side effects like data fetching

question_text: How do you navigate between screens in React Native?
option_d: Using React Navigation library or native navigation solutions.

question_text: What is React Navigation?
option_d: Popular library for handling navigation in React Native apps.

question_text: How do you install React Navigation?
option_d: npm install @react-navigation/native and required navigators.

question_text: What is Stack Navigator?
option_d: A navigator that provides a way for your app to transition between screens.

question_text: How do you create a stack navigator?
option_d: import { createStackNavigator } from '@react-navigation/stack'; const Stack = createStackNavigator();

question_text: What is Tab Navigator?
option_d: A navigator that displays tabs at the bottom or top for switching between screens.

question_text: How do you display images in React Native?
option_d: Using <Image> component with source prop.

question_text: What are the image source types in React Native?
option_d: Local images (require())

question_text: How do you load local images?
option_d: <Image source={require('./path/to/image.png')} />

question_text: How do you load network images?
option_d: <Image source={{uri: 'https://example.com/image.jpg'}} style={styles.image} />

question_text: What is ScrollView component?
option_d: A generic scrolling container that can host multiple components and views.

question_text: When should you use ScrollView?
option_d: When you have a bounded amount of content to scroll through.

question_text: What is FlatList component?
option_d: Component for rendering performant scrollable lists with large datasets.

question_text: Why use FlatList over ScrollView for lists?
option_d: FlatList is more performant for long lists with lazy loading and memory optimization.

question_text: How do you create a list with FlatList?
option_d: <FlatList data={data} renderItem={({item}) => <Text>{item.title}</Text>} keyExtractor={item => item.id} />

question_text: What is SectionList component?
option_d: A component for rendering sectioned lists

question_text: How do you make HTTP requests in React Native?
option_d: Using fetch API or libraries like axios.

question_text: What is fetch API in React Native?
option_d: Built-in API for making network requests

question_text: How do you use fetch to get data?
option_d: fetch('https://api.example.com/data').then(response => response.json()).then(data => console.log(data));

question_text: What is AsyncStorage in React Native?
option_d: Simple

question_text: How do you store data using AsyncStorage?
option_d: AsyncStorage.setItem('key'

question_text: What is debugging in React Native?
option_d: Identifying and fixing errors in React Native applications.

question_text: How do you debug React Native apps?
option_d: Using Chrome Developer Tools

question_text: What is React Native Debugger?
option_d: A standalone app for debugging React Native applications with React DevTools.

question_text: How do you handle errors in React Native?
option_d: Using try-catch blocks

question_text: What are React Native gestures?
option_d: Handling touch gestures like taps

question_text: How do you handle swipe gestures?
option_d: Using PanResponder or gesture handler libraries like react-native-gesture-handler.

question_text: What is react-native-gesture-handler?
option_d: A native touch and gesture system for React Native.

question_text: How do you handle permissions in React Native?
option_d: Using PermissionsAndroid for Android or requesting specific iOS permissions.

question_text: What is camera access permission?
option_d: Permission needed to access device camera for taking photos or videos.

question_text: How do you access device camera?
option_d: Using react-native-camera library or expo-camera module.

question_text: What is geolocation in React Native?
option_d: Accessing device's geographical location information.

question_text: How do you get user location?
option_d: navigator.geolocation.getCurrentPosition() or using react-native-geolocation-service.

question_text: What is push notifications in React Native?
option_d: Sending notifications to user devices from a server.

question_text: How do you implement push notifications?
option_d: Using react-native-push-notification library or Firebase Cloud Messaging.

question_text: What is Firebase in React Native?
option_d: A Backend-as-a-Service platform for mobile and web apps.

question_text: How do you integrate Firebase?
option_d: Using react-native-firebase library and configuring firebase.json.

question_text: What is authentication in React Native?
option_d: Verifying user identity using email/password

question_text: How do you implement user authentication?
option_d: Using Firebase Auth
explanation: or custom backend with JWT tokens.

question_text: What is Redux in React Native?
option_d: A predictable state container for JavaScript apps

question_text: When should you use Redux in React Native?
option_d: When app state is complex

question_text: What is Context API in React Native?
option_d: React's built-in state management solution for avoiding prop drilling.

question_text: How do you use Context API?
option_d: Creating context with React.createContext() and providing values with Provider.

question_text: What is animation in React Native?
option_d: Creating smooth transitions and movements in the user interface.

question_text: How do you create animations?
option_d: Using Animated API or react-native-reanimated library.

question_text: What is Animated API?
option_d: React Native's built-in API for creating smooth animations and transitions.

question_text: How do you animate a view?
option_d: Using Animated.View component with interpolation and timing/spring animations.

question_text: What is responsive design in React Native?
option_d: Designing apps that work well on different screen sizes and orientations.

question_text: How do you make responsive layouts?
option_d: Using Dimensions API

question_text: What is Dimensions API?
option_d: API to get device screen dimensions for responsive design.

question_text: How do you get screen dimensions?
option_d: import { Dimensions } from 'react-native'; const { width

question_text: What is Platform API?
option_d: API to detect the current platform (iOS

question_text: How do you write platform-specific code?
option_d: Using Platform.OS checks or .ios/.android file extensions.

question_text: What is testing in React Native?
option_d: Verifying that app components work correctly through unit and integration tests.

question_text: How do you test React Native components?
option_d: Using Jest and React Native Testing Library.

question_text: What is Jest in React Native?
option_d: JavaScript testing framework used for unit testing React Native apps.

question_text: How do you run tests?
option_d: npm test or yarn test in project directory.

question_text: What is app deployment in React Native?
option_d: Preparing and distributing React Native apps to app stores.

question_text: How do you build Android APK?
option_d: Using cd android && ./gradlew assembleRelease for CLI or generating signed APK.

question_text: How do you build iOS app?
option_d: Using Xcode to archive and distribute the app.

question_text: What is app signing in Android?
option_d: Process of digitally signing APK with a keystore for Google Play Store submission.

question_text: What is app store submission?
option_d: Process of submitting app to Apple App Store or Google Play Store for distribution.

question_text: How do you update React Native version?
option_d: Using react-native upgrade command or manual migration.

question_text: What are common React Native errors?
option_d: Common errors include undefined is not an object

question_text: How do you fix "undefined is not an object" error?
option_d: Checking for undefined variables

question_text: What is performance optimization in React Native?
option_d: Techniques to improve app speed

question_text: How do you improve React Native app performance?
option_d: Using PureComponent

question_text: What is the future of React Native?
option_d: Continued growth with new architecture (Fabric)
